title: Textile, 1893
inscribed: written in pencil on brown paper binding tape, "GLASS-SILK CLOTH -1893 MADE INTO A DRESS" and in pencil on other side, "Glass cloth woven for Dress Worn by Spanish Princess at 1893 World's Fair Chicago"
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 14 x 21.5 cm (5 1/2 x 8 7/16 in.)
description: Simple design of small rectangle made by the structure.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1893.
1893. Medium: glass-silk
Technique: plain weave. Gift of Milton Sonday. 1988-12-3.
